treatment.reference: Bergey’s Manual generic description pg 181, pg 182.
treatment.file: Cells cocci. Stains Gram-negative. Utilizes protein, peptides, or carbohydrates facultatively by sulfur respiration or fermentation. Growth by sulfur reduction to H2S. Cell envelope flexible. Forms a strongly smelling unknown product. Motile. Optimum pH for growth 6.0. Optimum temperature for growth 85˚C. Sugars not used. Lives in solfataric hot springs at pH 2.2-6.5 and up to 97˚C. The mol% G+C of the DNA is 50. The major core lipids are glycerol dialkyglycerol tetraethers and 2,3-di-O-phytanyl-sn-glycerol. Resistant to rifampicin and streptolydigin.
